content: flap place dividing sts for heel flap marker work the next row of chart or written heel flap instructions 7 8 9 times over 28 32 36 sts divide sts as follows work as established place marker pick up and knit 12 14 18 sts for 28 32 36 sts for the front of sock and in edge of heel flap k across 9 10 11 sts the remaining 28 32 36 sts for the heel 70 80 94 sts flap gusset decreases row 1 rs sl 1 k1 14 16 18 times row 2 ws sl 1 purl to end of row round 1 k until 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 slip marker work as established over repeat row 1 and 2 until there are 12 14 18 top of foot slip marker ssk k until end of slipped sts on the side of the heel flap round round 2 k until marker slip marker work 5 as established over top of foot slip marker k until end of round repeat the last 2 rounds until 56 64 72 sts remain foot of sock k until marker slip marker work as established repeating row 1-4 over top of foot slip marker k until end of round continue until desired length or 1 5 inches / 3 8 cm from finished length toe finishing decrease round k until 3 sts before marker graft 20 20 26 sts sts together using your k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k until 3 sts preferred grating technique or as follows before marker k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k until end of round kitchener for knit/ stockinette next round knit front needle insert tapestry needle knitwise drop the stitch repeat last 2 rounds until 20 20 26 sts remain front needle insert tapestry needle purlwise leave the stitch on the needle back needle insert tapestry needle purlwise drop the stitch back needle insert tapestry needle knitwise leave the stitch on the needle weave in ends with tapestry needle soak socks in lukewarm water for 15 - 20 minutes press out water with a towel place on sock blockers or lay flat to air dry enjoy your starfall socks 6 copyright kayla baldwin 2025 this pattern is for personal use only it is not to be copied and distributed in any part it is not permissible to sell finished items made from this pattern without express permission from the author contact i design visually intricate patterns that are surprisingly simple to knit making beautiful complex-looking projects accessible to all regardless of skill level or yarn choice every new pattern launches with the first 50 copies free and half price for the first week follow me on instagram for early access new designs and giveaways ravelry ravelry designs by kayla baldwin instagram https //www instagram com/natural knits/ abbreviations and techniques st s stitch es k knit p purl bor beginning of round co cast on pm place marker sl slip one stitch generally purlwise
